com.jpmorgan.mds.mercury.helper.chain

Interface MdsOmPubChain

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MdsOmChain

    public interface MdsOmPubChain
    This class is for publishing chains. A chain is composed of links(each of which is a MamaMsg stored in the infrastructure). Each link has elements, which are strings(most commonly used to store symbol names). This link fields have names line LINK_1 or LONGLINK1. There are typically 14 elements in a link msg. A template name may be used. The template is located in the mama.properties file. If there is no template then the link names LINK! ... LINK14 are used.

    • Method Detail

      • setPublisherCallback

        void setPublisherCallback(MdsOmPublisherCallback cb,
                        java.lang.Object closure)
        Set the publisher events callback.
        Parameters:
        cb - - the callback interface.
        closure - - returned with the callback.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroy the chain.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • publish

        void publish()
        Publish the chain. This only publishes links with elements that have changed.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • publishAll

        void publishAll()
        Publish the entire chain. It marks all elements as changed before the publish.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • drop

        void drop()
        Drop the entire chain. This deletes all of the link msgs from the infrastructure(RMDS or Solace).
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • publishOne

        void publishOne()
        Publish the chain. This method and PublishTwo are used only if the app wants to add additional fields to the link msgs. See the MdsOmChain sample app for usage.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • publishOneAll

        void publishOneAll()
        Publish the entire chain. This method and PublishTwo are used only if the app wants to add additional fields to the link msgs. See the MdsOmChain sample app for usage.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • publishTwo

        void publishTwo()
        Publish the chain. This method and PublishTwo are used only if the app wants to add additional fields to the link msgs. See the MdsOmChain sample app for usage.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus

      • getElementCount

        int getElementCount()
        Get the number of elements in a chain. This is a count of the elements in all of the links.
        Returns:
        the count of elements.

      • getElements

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getElements()
        Get the elements in a chain. This is a list of all of the elements(usually a list of symbol names).
        Parameters:
        l - - a list to put the elements in. If NULL then a new list is returned. If not NULL then the param list is cleared first and then loaded with the elements.
        Returns:
        the elements in a list.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus.

      • getLinkCount

        int getLinkCount()
        Get the number of links in a chain.
        Returns:
        the count of links.

      • getLinkNames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLinkNames()
        Get the link names in a chain. The link names are the subject names of each link.
        Parameters:
        l - - a list to put the links in. If NULL then a new list is returned. If not NULL then the param list is cleared first and then loaded with the links.
        Returns:
        the names.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus.

      • getLinks

        java.util.List<MdsOmDataLink> getLinks()
        Get the links in a chain.
        Parameters:
        l - - a list to put the links in. If NULL then a new list is returned. If not NULL then the param list is cleared first and then loaded with the links.
        Returns:
        the links.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus.

        Parameters:

        MdsOmStatus

      • clearChain

        void clearChain()
        Clear the chain. This removes all of the links and elements.
        Throws:
        MamaStatus, - MdsOmStatus.

      • getChainName

        java.lang.String getChainName()
        Get the chain name, which is the same as the name of the 1st link.
        Returns:
        the name.

      • getSymbol

        java.lang.String getSymbol()
        Get the symbol name. This is the part of the subject after the source. For example, if the subject is PB-NAMR-DEV.0#AULH6DEL.lonres then the symbol=0#AULH6DEL.lonres.
        Returns:
        the symbol.

      • getSource

        java.lang.String getSource()
        Get the source name. This is the part of the subject at the beginning. For example, if the subject is PB-NAMR-DEV.0#AULH6DEL.lonres then the source=PB-NAMR-DEV.
        Returns:
        the source.

      • getSubject

        java.lang.String getSubject()
        Get the subject name. This is the entire name. For example, the subject is PB-NAMR-DEV.0#AULH6DEL.lonres.
        Returns:
        the subject.

      • getTime

        long getTime()
        Get the seconds to subscribe to the entire chain.
        Returns:
        the seconds.
